teams.name: General Ken‑obi
teams.roast: We’re all just hoping you oversleep on waiver day.
teams.blurb: Four startable QBs, a three-headed RB monster and a WR corps that could headline Coachella. You won it all in 2023 and made the semis in 2024; you’re the consensus favourite again.
teams.preseasonEssay: Since capturing the 2023 title you’ve become the franchise everyone measures themselves against. A surprise early exit in 2024 barely dented your aura – your bench could compete in most leagues. The 2025 roster reads like the All-Pro team: Maye and Richardson headline a four-deep quarterback room with J.J. McCarthy and Trevor Lawrence backing them up. Saquon Barkley and Kenneth Walker are both in their primes behind improved offensive lines. CeeDee Lamb landed inside the top ten of ESPN’s 2025 overall fantasy rankings while Nico Collins and Drake London are ascending stars. The only real question is how to distribute touches. Your schedule is average and projections peg you around 48.9 points per week, but with this talent the ceiling is limitless. The group chat loves to tease you about passing on Jordan Addison back in 2023 and your never-ending taxi squad debates, but they’d trade places with you in a second.

teams.name: Noble FFT
teams.roast: Bijan and Breece are gods, your tight ends are mortals.
teams.blurb: A disappointing 7th-place finish last year masks how loaded you are: Bijan–Breece at RB and Caleb at QB make you the consensus No. 2. Fix tight end and you could be lifting the trophy.
teams.preseasonEssay: After finishing in the consolation bracket in 2024 you come into 2025 with the league’s scariest backfield. Bijan Robinson and Breece Hall both rank among the top fantasy backs and give you a weekly floor others envy. Rookie quarterback Caleb Williams arrives with as much hype as any prospect in a decade, and Jordan Love is a handy insurance policy. With A.J. Brown and Tee Higgins manning the flanks your weekly projection sits around 45 points. What’s missing? An elite tight end and a little receiver depth keep you in the frisky tier for now. Historically you’ve drafted like a real-life GM, making big bets on young cores. Your schedule is slightly tougher than average, but a healthy Higgins contract and a midseason trade for a tight end could vault you into the title conversation.

teams.name: MHJTIME
teams.roast: If you ever find two real running backs, the rest of us are toast.
teams.blurb: Last in 2023, semifinalist in 2024, top three in 2025. The best WR trio on the planet and a top-five tight end make you lethal; the only thing between you and a title is your RB room.
teams.preseasonEssay: Few franchises have turned things around as dramatically as MHJTIME. You were the toilet-bowl runner-up in 2023, surged to a third-place finish last season and now sit firmly among the contenders. Ja’Marr Chase and Malik Nabers are both top-ten overall assets and teaming them with Marvin Harrison Jr. gives you a historic trio. Trey McBride blossomed into a top-five tight end. Rookie quarterback Jayden Daniels brings electric rushing upside. The downside: your running backs are patchwork – Chuba Hubbard and Brian Robinson might combine for a dozen points on a bad day. With a slightly above-average schedule and a projected 47 points per week, you’re a trade or rookie breakout away from a title. Sit tight and it could be another “what if” year.

teams.name: Ghastly Grayskull Gang
teams.roast: Your pick stash is bigger than your WR room.
teams.blurb: From the consolation bracket to a top-four power rank in two years. Stroud and Bowers form a terrifying core; use your mountain of picks to buy a proper WR1 and crash the finals.
teams.preseasonEssay: It takes patience to turn draft picks into production, and you’ve executed the blueprint. After ranking tenth in starters using our metrics, you cashed in capital to load up on explosive young runners and paired them with C.J. Stroud and Brock Bowers – both consensus top-five dynasty assets. The receiver room remains thin; Xavier Worthy’s 4.21 speed will blow up highlight reels, but DK Metcalf and Deebo Samuel are better complementary pieces than primary alphas. Your schedule is modest and the weekly projection hovers around 44 points. Henderson or Hampton hitting would put you in the mix. Pundits in the chat love to remind you that picks don’t score points; 2025 is your chance to prove them wrong.

teams.name: Rasheeing the Scene
teams.roast: Your WR room is a meme waiting to happen.
teams.blurb: Fifth and fifth the last two years. Josh Allen is an MVP, your RB room is a Ferrari and your WRs are barely road legal. Without a true WR1 you’re stuck in the frisky middle.
teams.preseasonEssay: This roster is a weekly thrill ride: you led the league in points several weeks in 2024 yet still finished fifth. Josh Allen is still the QB1 on most boards and your committee of rookies – De’Von Achane, Bucky Irving, Quinshon Judkins – oozes upside. Rashee Rice’s suspension and the lack of a true alpha receiver leave you praying for touchdown variance. Projections around 44 points mirror that imbalance, and the schedule doesn’t help. The consensus in the chat: invest in a steady WR1 rather than another speedster. If you can flip a pick for a reliable receiver, you could finally convert big totals into a deep run.

teams.name: Kittler on the Roof
teams.roast: Your floor is nice but your ceiling might be drywall.
teams.blurb: Back-to-back finals appearances capped with a 2024 title. The core is aging and thin behind the starters, so the models drop you to sixth. Your consistency will keep you in the hunt.
teams.preseasonEssay: The defending champion returns most of its core, but regression is a fickle thing. Joe Burrow, Jonathan Taylor and Puka Nacua all battled injuries last season. If they rebound, the starting lineup remains as steady as any. Your weekly projection around 46 points is tied for third-highest, though depth is still a concern – one injury and you’re starting Bryce Young. The schedule is slightly tougher than average. You’ve thrived on consistency: runner-up in 2022, runner-up again in 2023, champion in 2024. Whether the magic continues or Father Time intervenes remains to be seen. Expect plenty of sarcastic chat messages about “trusting the process” whenever Tony Pollard has a three-yard carry.

teams.name: Chudders Football Team
teams.roast: Two firsts in two years and Gibbs. You’re that guy bench-pressing next to the trophy case.
teams.blurb: You’ve been stuck around eighth, but your draft capital is unmatched. Build around Gibbs and Herbert, and next year’s ranking could look very different.
teams.preseasonEssay: The rebuild is in full swing. Jahmyr Gibbs and Ashton Jeanty give you perhaps the best young RB duo in the league, and Justin Herbert remains underrated in dynasty circles. Unfortunately the WR room is barren and your backup QBs read like waiver-wire fodder. With a league-high haul of first-round picks you’re clearly playing for 2026. Your weekly projection around 39 points and a middling schedule suggest a long season, but with two years of drafts to come, you can afford the lumps. The chat jokes about you icing trade offers; given your war chest you can afford to wait until the picks mature.

teams.name: Burden of Etienne‑y Woody
teams.roast: Justin Jefferson can only carry you so far.
teams.blurb: Solidly in the middle of the pack the last two years. Jefferson and Aiyuk offer hope, but quarterback and running-back roulette drag you down. Use those extra firsts to find a real QB.
teams.preseasonEssay: You’re a cautionary tale of stars without support. Justin Jefferson remains a top-three overall asset, and Mark Andrews plus Dalton Kincaid gives you arguably the best tight-end room in the league. Yet Kyler Murray’s health is a question mark, your running backs are a triage unit and depth behind Jefferson is thin. Your weekly projection sits around 43 points and the schedule is friendly, but you’ve lingered in the lower half of the standings the past two seasons. Rumours in the chat suggest you might trade Jefferson for a king’s ransom to jump-start a rebuild. Do it and 2025 becomes the beginning of a new arc; don’t and you risk lingering in purgatory.
championshipHistory: Lower half of standings past 2 years

teams.name: The Legion of Bouz
teams.roast: Mahomes and ARSB deserve a tight end with a pulse.
teams.blurb: You took home the 2022 trophy but have slid since. Mahomes and your WR trio still scare everyone, but your RBs and TEs are aging fast. A rebuild may be closer than you think.
teams.preseasonEssay: Since winning the inaugural title in 2022, you’ve been stuck in the middle. Patrick Mahomes and Amon-Ra St. Brown anchor an electric passing attack. Christian McCaffrey and Jaylen Waddle are still elite assets, but Joe Mixon and Aaron Jones are nearing the cliff, and your tight-end room is empty. Projected weekly points sit around 45 and your schedule ranks slightly above average. You’ve thrived on big swings — remember trading for Mahomes in 2023? To make another run, you’ll likely need to package a receiver or back for an elite tight end or youth infusion. Until then expect more jokes about your “Voltron receivers” in the chat and another 7–6 season.

teams.name: Father Time
teams.roast: Your WRs are wagyu beef; your RBs are ramen noodles.
teams.blurb: Semi-finalist in 2024 but sliding in 2025. Your veteran WR room props up the value, but the backfield and tight ends put a hard cap on your upside.
teams.preseasonEssay: Living up to your name, your roster reads like a “Who’s Who” of rookies and veterans. Brian Thomas Jr. and Ladd McConkey headline the 2024 rookie class; Rome Odunze waits in the wings. Your running backs are all committee pieces and Bo Nix profiles as a mid-range QB2. Weekly projections around 45 points and a schedule near the middle scream mediocrity. Your best hope is that one of Warren or Guerendo seizes a backfield and Odunze ascends quickly. Otherwise you’re a classic spoiler who knocks contenders out of the playoffs but never raises the trophy. The chat will love your random 180-point weeks and ignore the rest.

teams.name: Sleeping Giants
teams.roast: Your WRs peaked when Fortnite did.
teams.blurb: You rode Hurts and a deep backfield to the 2024 final but fell short. Time is catching up to your receivers. Sell a vet and pivot before the window slams shut.
teams.preseasonEssay: The name says it all: a roster of aging stars that could awaken for one more run. Derrick Henry and Josh Jacobs remain workhorses but both have more than 1,500 career carries. Jalen Hurts is a cheat code, and Jordan Addison appears ready to claim a bigger role opposite Cooper Kupp and Keenan Allen. Your weekly projection around 45 points and one of the league’s softest schedules suggest you’re fighting uphill. You’ve reached a championship (2024) and a semifinal in the last three seasons; if the veterans hold up you could sneak into the playoffs again. If not, trade those names and embrace the rebuild—before the chat starts calling you the “Island of Misfit WR1s” again.

teams.name: The Boonist Monks
teams.roast: Your team could win it all or retire it all.
teams.blurb: Third place in 2023, eighth in 2024 and now you sit at the bottom. Lamar, Tyreek and Kelce can still win you weeks, but your running backs are getting old and there’s no draft capital to replenish them.
teams.preseasonEssay: After claiming third place in 2023, The Boonist Monks looked mortal in 2024, bowing out before the semifinals. Lamar Jackson, Tyreek Hill and Travis Kelce are still video-game characters, but all three are approaching age cliffs. James Cook and David Montgomery provide steady RB production and Zay Flowers could ascend. Projected weekly points around 47 put you in contention and your schedule is favourable, but your lack of picks makes retooling tricky. In the group chat you’re often the instigator of side bets and polls; 2025 might be the season when you push all your chips in for one last run before selling the farm.
